chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
a: nat -> R
x: R

Goal:
Rbar_lt (Rabs x) (CV_radius a) -> ex_series (fun n : nat => Rabs (a n * x ^ n))

Premises:
ex_series = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) => exists l : V, is_series a l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
Rabs = fun r : R => if Rcase_abs r then - r else r : R -> R Argument scope is [R_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
CV_radius = fun a : nat -> R => Lub_Rbar (CV_disk a) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]
Rbar_lt = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite y0 => x0 < y0 | p_infty => True | m_infty => False end | p_infty => False | m_infty => match y with | m_infty => False | _ => True end end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
CV_radius_bounded : forall a : nat -> R, is_lub_Rbar (fun r : R => exists M : R, forall n : nat, Rabs (a n * r ^ n) <= M) (CV_radius a)
CV_disk = fun (a : nat -> R) (r : R) => ex_series (fun n : nat => Rabs (a n * r ^ n)) : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
ex_pseries_R : forall (a : nat -> R) (x : R), ex_pseries a x < -> ex_series (fun n : nat => a n * x ^ n)
ex_series_DAlembert : forall (a : nat -> R) (k : R), k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, a n <> 0) -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => Rabs (a (S n) / a n)) k -> ex_series (fun n : nat => Rabs (a n))
ex_series_Rabs : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series (fun n : nat => Rabs (a n)) -> ex_series a
ex_series_scal_r : forall (c : R) (a : nat -> R), ex_series a -> ex_series (fun n : nat => a n * c)
ex_series_geom : forall q : R, Rabs q < 1 -> ex_series (fun n : nat => q ^ n)
partial_summation_R : forall a b : nat -> R, (exists M : R, forall n : nat, norm (sum_n b n) <= M) -> filterlim a eventually (locally 0) -> ex_series (fun n : nat => norm (minus (a (S n)) (a n))) -> ex_series (fun n : nat => scal (a n) (b n))
Rbar_lt_locally : forall (a b : Rbar) (x : R), Rbar_lt a x -> Rbar_lt x b -> exists delta : posreal, forall y : R, Rabs (y - x) < delta -> Rbar_lt a y /\ Rbar_lt y b
Pser = fun (An : nat -> R) (x l : R) => infinite_sum (fun n : nat => An n * x ^ n) l : (nat -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
is_series_scal_r : forall (c : R) (a : nat -> R) (l : R), is_series a l -> is_series (fun n : nat => a n * c) (l * c)
is_series_geom : forall q : R, Rabs q < 1 -> is_series (fun n : nat => q ^ n) (/ (1 - q))
ex_series_scal_l : forall (c : ?K) (a0 : nat -> ?V), ex_series a0 -> ex_series (fun n : nat => scal c (a0 n)) where ?K : [a : nat -> R x : R |- AbsRing] ?V : [a : nat -> R x : R |- NormedModule ?K]
Rabs_Rabsolu : forall x : R, Rabs (Rabs x) = Rabs x
AlembertC3_step1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x <> 0 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
CV_radius_ge_0 : forall a : nat -> R, Rbar_le 0 (CV_radius a)
ex_series_ext : forall a0 b : nat -> ?V, (forall n : nat, a0 n = b n) -> ex_series a0 -> ex_series b where ?K : [a : nat -> R x : R |- AbsRing] ?V : [a : nat -> R x : R |- NormedModule ?K]
incr_function : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : Rbar) (df : R -> R), (forall x : R, Rbar_lt a x -> Rbar_lt x b -> is_derive f x (df x)) -> (forall x : R, Rbar_lt a x -> Rbar_lt x b -> df x > 0) -> forall x y : R, Rbar_lt a x -> x < y -> Rbar_lt y b -> f x < f y
is_lim_seq' = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, eventually (fun n : nat => Rabs (u n - l0) < eps) | p_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => M < u n) | m_infty => forall M : R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n < M) end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
ex_series_le : forall (a0 : nat -> ?V) (b : nat -> R), (forall n : nat, norm (a0 n) <= b n) -> ex_series b -> ex_series a0 where ?K : [a : nat -> R x : R |- AbsRing] ?V : [a : nat -> R x : R |- CompleteNormedModule ?K]
eventually_filter = {| filter_ex := fun (P : nat -> Prop) (H0 : eventually P) => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ N H => ex_intro (fun x : nat => P x) N (H N (Nat.le_refl N)) end; filter_filter := {| filter_true := ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> True) 0%nat (fun (n : nat) (_ : (0 <= n)%nat) => I); filter_and := fun (P Q : nat -> Prop) (H : eventually P) => match H with | @ex_intro _ _ NP HP => fun H0 : eventually Q => match H0 with | @ex_intro _ _ NQ HQ => ex_intro (fun N : nat => forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n /\ Q n) (Init.Nat.max NP NQ) (fun (n : nat) (Hn : (Init.Nat.max NP NQ <= n)%nat) => conj (HP n (Nat.le_trans NP (Init.Nat.max NP N...
RPow_abs : forall (x : R) (n : nat), Rabs x ^ n = Rabs (x ^ n)
pow_le : forall (a : R) (n : nat), 0 <= a -> 0 <= a ^ n
ex_pseries = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) (x : K) => ex_series (fun k : nat => scal (pow_n x k) (a k)) : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> K -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _]
is_lim_seq_plus' : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l1 l2 : R), is_lim_seq u l1 -> is_lim_seq v l2 -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u n + v n) (l1 + l2)
ex_series_Reals_1 : forall a : nat -> R, {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 a N) l} -> ex_series a
MVT_gen : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (df : R -> R), let a0 := Rmin a b in let b0 := Rmax a b in (forall x : R, a0 < x < b0 -> is_derive f x (df x)) -> (forall x : R, a0 <= x <= b0 -> continuity_pt f x) -> exists c : R, a0 <= c <= b0 /\ f b - f a = df c * (b - a)
cauchy_abs : forall An : nat -> R, Cauchy_crit_series (fun i : nat => Rabs (An i)) -> Cauchy_crit_series An
pow_nonzero : forall (x : R) (n : nat), x <> 0 -> x ^ n <> 0
filter_imp : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x -> Q x) -> ?F P -> ?F Q where ?T : [a : nat -> R x : R |- Type] ?F : [a : nat -> R x : R |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [a : nat -> R x : R |- Filter ?F]
Rbar_lt_le_trans : forall x y z : Rbar, Rbar_lt x y -> Rbar_le y z -> Rbar_lt x z
Rbar_le_lt_trans : forall x y z : Rbar, Rbar_le x y -> Rbar_lt y z -> Rbar_lt x z
ex_series_Cauchy : forall a0 : nat -> ?V, Cauchy_series a0 -> ex_series a0 where ?K : [a : nat -> R x : R |- AbsRing] ?V : [a : nat -> R x : R |- CompleteNormedModule ?K]
Cauchy_ex_series : forall a0 : nat -> ?V, ex_series a0 -> Cauchy_series a0 where ?K : [a : nat -> R x : R |- AbsRing] ?V : [a : nat -> R x : R |- CompleteNormedModule ?K]
lt = fun n m : nat => (S n <= m)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
is_lim_seq_incr_1 : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l < -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (S n)) l
sum_n = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n : nat) => sum_n_m a 0 n : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope]
pow = fix pow (r : R) (n : nat) {struct n} : R := match n with | 0%nat => 1 | S n0 => r * pow r n0 end : R -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope nat_scope]
eventually = fun P : nat -> Prop => exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n : (nat -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]

```coq
intros a x H. apply ex_series_Rabs. apply ex_series_ext with (fun n => Rabs (a n * x ^ n)).
- intros n. rewrite Rabs_Rabsolu. reflexivity.
- apply ex_pseries_R. apply H.
Qed.
```
